alert.note: Alert for Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 11:51PM EST until December 20 at 1:24AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Nash, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell across the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Goldsboro, Roanoke Rapids, Tarboro, Nashville, Mount Olive, Louisburg, Warrenton, Halifax, Wilson, Scotland Neck, Franklinton, Elm City, Fremont, Norlina, Dortches, Walnut Creek, Littleton, Bailey and Bunn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
